info.title: Files required in a live patch package

section.para: To prepare a live patch package, use the glibc-livepatches as a reference source. The package contains the following files:

listitem.para: glibc-livepatches.spec; for details, refer to .
glibc-livepatches-VERSION.tar.xz; for details, refer to .

section.title: The glibc-livepatches.spec file
section.para: The glibc-livepatches.spec file contains instructions on how to prepare, build, install and apply the live patch.

The file also calls the ulp_post_hook script. The script calls the ULP trigger with extracted boilerplate code to avoid adding such a code to every package. To check the code, view the file /usr/lib/userspace-livepatch/rpm-helper. The call to the ULP trigger is performed with the –revert-all command that reverts all already installed patches. Make sure that your patch is cumulative and contains fixes for the previous versions of the patch.

section.title: The glibc-livepatches.tar.xz file
section.para: The glibc-livepatches.tar.xz file contains the actual source code of the live patch. The archive must also contain information about all glibc versions issued for the particular SLE version.
